title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: This table presents 2024 school enrollment statistics for children in Chhattisgarh, categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 15-16) and gender. It details the percentage distribution across government and private schools, as well as out-of-school rates. It also includes Chart 1, which tracks trends of out-of-school children aged 11-16 from 2006 to 2024.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Data from 2022 showing the educational status of young children (ages 3 to 8) in Chhattisgarh, distinguishing between pre-school (Anganwadi, Govt, Pvt) and formal school enrollment. It also includes Chart 2, illustrating trends in government school enrollment for Std I-V and VI-VIII for the years 2018, 2022, and 2024.

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: A 2024 numeracy assessment for students in Grades I through VIII in Chhattisgarh. The table categorizes children based on their highest arithmetic capability, ranging from number recognition (1-9, 10-99) to performing subtraction and division.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Time-series data (2014-2024) tracking the arithmetic skills of Standard III students in Chhattisgarh. It specifically shows the percentage of children capable of doing at least subtraction, broken down by government and private school sectors.

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive infrastructure survey of Chhattisgarh schools (2010-2024), tracking the availability and usability of facilities including mid-day meals, drinking water, toilets (general and girls'), libraries, electricity, and computers.
data: | Mid-day meal | Mid-day meal served in school on the day of visit | 94.6 | 91.7 | 93.6 | 96.3 |
| Mid-day meal | Kitchen/shed for cooking mid-day meal | 86.1 | 97.0 | 93.5 | 90.9 |
| Drinking water | No facility for drinking water | 12.9 | 7.9 | 7.3 | 9.8 |
| Drinking water | Facility but no drinking water available | 9.6 | 9.6 | 10.6 | 9.0 |
| Toilet | Facility but toilet not useable | 41.5 | 12.2 | 22.7 | 18.7 |
| Girls' toilet | No separate provision for girls' toilet | 46.2 | 10.1 | 16.5 | 18.9 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision but locked | 16.3 | 3.2 | 7.5 | 6.4 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked but not useable | 17.5 | 11.0 | 16.0 | 12.1 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked and useable | 20.0 | 75.7 | 60.0 | 62.7 |
| Library | Library but no books being used by children on the day of visit | 36.5 | 66.0 | 59.5 | 47.1 |
| Library | Library books being used by children on the day of visit | 36.5 | 23.8 | 24.9 | 41.8 |
| Electricity | Of schools with electricity connection, % schools with electricity available on the day of visit |  | 82.0 | 83.7 | 89.8 |
| Computer | No computer available for children to use | 95.9 | 97.7 | 96.8 | 96.5 |
| Computer | Computer available but not being used by children on the day of visit | 2.4 | 1.9 | 2.9 | 3.0 |
| Computer | Computer being used by children on the day of visit | 1.7 | 0.4 | 0.3 | 0.5 |

title: Table 21: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) activities. 2024
description: Implementation status of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) initiatives in Chhattisgarh for the 2023-24 and 2024-25 academic years. This table covers government directives, teacher training (online and offline), material distribution (TLM), and school readiness programs.
